steps.name: go to url
steps.description: Loads a web page in the current browser session

steps.name: get page title
steps.description: Returns the title of the current page

steps.name: find element
steps.description: find element with locator value

steps.name: find elements
steps.description: find all elements with locator value

steps.name: try to find element
steps.description: try to find element

steps.name: try to find elements
steps.description: try to find elements

steps.name: get elements text
steps.description: get text from elements

steps.name: find element's last children
steps.description: get the last elements in the tree from the root element

steps.name: find elements last children
steps.description: get the last elements in the tree from the root elements

steps.name: find element children
steps.description: get the children of the parent element

steps.name: find elements children
steps.description: get the children of the parent elements

steps.name: zoom
steps.description: zoom in/out (might not work for any web browser)

steps.name: go to page
steps.description:
works on web, not mobile.
If url is set to None nothing will happen

steps.name: wait until page loads
steps.description: check that the page has finished loading and all elements are present

steps.name: count all the elements in the page
steps.description: count all the elements in the page

steps.name: find all the elements in the page
steps.description: finds all the elements in the page

steps.name: click on element
steps.description: click on an element

steps.name: try to click on element
steps.description: click on an element

steps.name: click on elements
steps.description: click on elements

steps.name: drag and drop
steps.description: drag and drop source element on a target element

steps.name: drag to offset
steps.description: drag and drop source element on a (x,y) offset

description: hover/move cursor to element

name: hover and click on element
description: hover/move cursor to element and click

name: scroll element into view
description: selenium only: scrolling function to scroll until element is visible (whole window scroll)

name: clear element's text
description: clears the text if it's a text entry element

name: send keys to element
description: click on element, clear element text, send keys to element

name: send key by key to element
description:
click on element, clear element text, send individual characters to element.
this function is useful in flacky applications, where the send keys function can cause issues

name: send keys to elements
description: send text to multiple elements

name: select element
description: select options that match the choice

name: select element from dropdown
description: select a choice from a drop down list

name: select elements from dropdown
description: select a choice from a drop down list

name: replace url pattern
description: replace page url pattern

name: try to click until element is created
click until element is created
description:
click on element, check if condition element is created, if not, click again.
raise Exception for failure

name: try to click until condition as expected
click until condition as expected
description:
click on element, check if:
locator_condition count is equal to condition_expected_count_results, if not, click again.
raise Exception for failure

name: try to click until element is deleted
click until element is deleted
description:
click on element, check if:
locator_of_deleted_element has been deleted, if its not deleted retry!
raise Exception for failure

name: try to confirm element is deleted
confirm element is deleted
refresh page until elements are found
description:
let's say you landed on an unexpected page/content
and you want to refresh and assert you have the correct content (really weird scenario)
this method will search for an element, if the search result is 0 it will refresh the page and retry

name: click until url changes
description: click on element, check if url changed, if not, click again

name: assert element is not clickable
description:
some elements might be click-able but the click action does nothing,
in that case use something like click_do_nothing(locator_to_click, locator_expectation)
where you can check if some event happened

name: assert clicking has no effect
description: check if some event(locator_expectation) happened after trying to click

name: assert element does not exist
description:
check if some event(locator_expectation) happened after trying to click.
search for element, expect not to find it

steps.name: get mobile device
steps.description: Returns a mobile device object

steps.name: get browser name
steps.description: Returns the name of the underlying browser for this instance

steps.name: start session
steps.description: Creates a session with the desired capabilities

steps.name: create element
steps.description: Creates a web element with the specified `element_id`

steps.name: execute command
steps.description:
Sends a command to be executed by a command.CommandExecutor

:Args:
  driver_command: The name of the command to execute as a string
  params: A dictionary of named parameters to send with the command

:Returns:
  The command's JSON response loaded into a dictionary object

steps.name: execute script
steps.description:
Synchronously Executes JavaScript in the current window/frame

:Args:
  script: The JavaScript to execute
  *args: Any applicable arguments for your JavaScript

:Usage:
  app.driver.execute_async_script("return document.title;")

steps.name: execute async script
steps.description:
Asynchronously Executes JavaScript in the current window/frame

:Args:
  script: The JavaScript to execute
  *args: Any applicable arguments for your JavaScript

:Usage:
  app.driver.execute_async_script("var callback = arguments[arguments.length - 1]; window.setTimeout(function(){ callback('timeout') }, 3000);")

steps.name: get page source
steps.description: Gets the URL of the current page.

steps.name: get page source
steps.description: Gets the source of the current page

steps.name: close window
steps.description: Closes the current window

steps.name: close driver
steps.description: Quits the driver and closes every associated window

steps.name: get current window handle
steps.description: Returns the handle of the current window

steps.name: get window handles
steps.description: Returns the handles of all windows within the current session

steps.name: maximize window
steps.description: Maximizes the current window that webdriver is using

steps.name: fullscreen window
steps.description: Invokes the window manager-specific 'full screen' operation

steps.name: minimize window
steps.description: Invokes the window manager-specific 'minimize' operation

steps.name: switch to active element
steps.description: Switch to (focus on) active element

steps.name: switch to alert
steps.description: Switch to (focus on) alert content

steps.name: switch to default content
steps.description: Switch to (focus on) default content

steps.name: switch to frame
steps.description:
Switch to (focus on) frame content

Usage:
  app.driver.switch_to.frame('frame_name')
  app.driver.switch_to.frame(1)
  app.driver.switch_to.frame(app.find_all(('tag name', 'iframe')[0])

steps.name: switch to parent frame
steps.description: Switch to (focus on) parent frame content

steps.name: switch to window
steps.description:
Switch to (focus on) window/tab content

Usage:
  app.driver.switch_to.window('main')

steps.name: back
steps.description: Goes one step backward in the browser history

steps.name: forward
steps.description: Goes one step forward in the browser history

steps.name: refresh
steps.description: Refreshes the current page

steps.name: get cookie
steps.description: Get a single cookie by name. Returns the cookie if found, None if not

steps.name: get cookies
steps.description: Returns a set of dictionaries, corresponding to cookies visible in the current session

steps.name: delete cookie
steps.description: Deletes a single cookie with the given name

steps.name: delete cookie
steps.description: Deletes a single cookie with the given name

steps.name: delete all cookies
steps.description: Delete all cookies in the scope of the session

steps.name: add cookie
steps.description:
Adds a cookie to your current session.

:Args:
 - cookie_dict: A dictionary object, with required keys - "name" and "value";
   optional keys - "path", "domain", "secure", "expiry"

Usage:
    app.driver.add_cookie({'name' : 'foo', 'value' : 'bar'})
    app.driver.add_cookie({'name' : 'foo', 'value' : 'bar', 'path' : '/'})
    app.driver.add_cookie({'name' : 'foo', 'value' : 'bar', 'path' : '/', 'secure':True})

steps.name: set page load timeout
steps.description: Set the amount of time to wait for a page load to complete before throwing an error

steps.name: set script timeout
steps.description: Set the amount of time that the script should wait during an execute_async_script call before throwing an error

steps.name: implicitly wait
steps.description:
Sets a sticky timeout to implicitly wait for an element to be found,
or a command to complete. This method only needs to be called one
time per session. To set the timeout for calls to
execute_async_script, see set_script_timeout

steps.name: set window size
steps.description: Sets the width and height of the current window

steps.name: get window size
steps.description: Gets the width and height of the current window

steps.name: set window position
steps.description: Sets the x,y position of the current window

steps.name: get window position
steps.description: Gets the x,y position of the current window

steps.name: get capabilities
steps.description: returns the drivers current desired capabilities being used

steps.name: get base64 screenshot
steps.description: Gets a base64 encoded string screenshot which is useful in embedded images in HTML

steps.name: save screenshot
steps.description:
Saves a screenshot of the current window to a PNG image file.
Returns False if there is any IOError, else returns True.
Use full paths in your filename

steps.name: get screenshot
steps.description: Gets the screenshot of the current window as a binary data

steps.name: get file detector
steps.description:
Gets the file detector to be used when sending keyboard input.
By default, this is set to a file detector that does nothing

steps.name: get orientation
steps.description: Gets the current orientation of the device

steps.name: get application cache
steps.description: Returns a ApplicationCache Object to interact with the browser app cache

steps.name: get log types
steps.description: Gets a list of the available log types

steps.name: get log
steps.description: Gets the log for a given log type: 'browser' 'driver' 'client' 'server'

steps.name: tap
steps.description: Taps on an particular place with up to five fingers, holding for a certain time

steps.name: swipe
steps.description: Swipe from one point to another point, for an optional duration

steps.name: flick
steps.description: Flick from one point to another point

steps.name: pinch
steps.description: Pinch on an element a certain amount

steps.name: get app strings
steps.description: Returns the application strings from the device for the specified language

steps.name: reset
steps.description: Resets the current application on the device

steps.name: hide keyboard
steps.description:
Hides the software keyboard on the device. In iOS, use `key_name` to press
a particular key, or `strategy`. In Android, no parameters are used

steps.name: check keyboard is shown
steps.description: Attempts to detect whether a software keyboard is present

steps.name: key event
steps.description:
Sends a keycode to the device. Android only. Possible keycodes can be
found in http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent.html

steps.name: press key code
steps.description:
Sends a keycode to the device. Android only. Possible keycodes can be
found in http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent.html

steps.name: long press key code
steps.description:
Sends a long press keycode to the device. Android only. Possible keycodes can be
found in http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent.html

steps.name: get current activity
steps.description: Retrieves the current activity running on the device

steps.name: get current package
steps.description: Retrieves the current package running on the device

steps.name: wait for activity
steps.description: Wait for an activity: block until target activity presents or time out. This is an Android-only method

steps.name: set element value
steps.description: Set the value on an element in the application

steps.name: get file
steps.description: Retrieves the file at `path`. Returns the file's content encoded as Base64

steps.name: get folder
steps.description: Retrieves a folder at `path`. Returns the folder's contents zipped and encoded as Base64

steps.name: save file
steps.description: Puts the data, encoded as Base64, in the file specified as `path`

steps.name: hide app in background
steps.description: Puts the application in the background on the device for a certain duration

steps.name: check if app is installed
steps.description: Checks whether the application specified by `bundle_id` is installed on the device

steps.name: install app
steps.description: Install the application found at `app_path` on the device

steps.name: remove app
steps.description: Remove the specified application from the device

steps.name: launch app
steps.description: Start on the device the application specified in the desired capabilities

steps.name: close app
steps.description: Stop the running application, specified in the desired capabilities, on the device

steps.name: terminate app
steps.description: Terminates the application if it is running

steps.name: activate app
steps.description: Activates the application if it is not running or is running in the background

steps.name: get app state
steps.description: Queries the state of the application

steps.name: start activity
steps.description:
Opens an arbitrary activity during a test. If the activity belongs to another application, that application is started and the activity is opened.
This is an Android-only method

steps.name: end test coverage
steps.description: Ends the coverage collection and pull the coverage.ec file from the device. Android only

steps.name: lock
steps.description:
Lock the device. No changes are made if the device is already unlocked

:Args:
  seconds - (optional) the duration to lock the device, in seconds.
  The device is going to be locked forever until `unlock` is called
  if it equals or is less than zero, otherwise this call blocks until
  the timeout expires and unlocks the screen automatically

steps.name: unlock
steps.description: Unlock the device. No changes are made if the device is already locked

steps.name: is locked
steps.description: Checks whether the device is locked

steps.name: shake
steps.description: shake the device

steps.name: touch id
steps.description: Simulate touchId on iOS Simulator

steps.name: toggle touch id enrollment
steps.description: Toggle enroll touchId on iOS Simulator

steps.name: open notifications
steps.description: Open notification shade in Android (API Level 18 and above)

steps.name: get network connection
steps.description:
Returns an integer bitmask specifying the network connection type.
Android only.
Possible values are available through the enumeration `appium.webdriver.ConnectionType`

steps.name: set network connection
steps.description:
Sets the network connection type. Android only.
Possible values:
    Value (Alias)      | Data | Wifi | Airplane Mode
    -------------------------------------------------
    0 (None)           | 0    | 0    | 0
    1 (Airplane Mode)  | 0    | 0    | 1
    2 (Wifi only)      | 0    | 1    | 0
    4 (Data only)      | 1    | 0    | 0
    6 (All network on) | 1    | 1    | 0
These are available through the enumeration `appium.webdriver.ConnectionType`

:Args:
  connectionType - a member of the enum appium.webdriver.ConnectionType

steps.name: get available ime engines
steps.description:
Get the available input methods for an Android device. Package and
activity are returned (e.g., ['com.android.inputmethod.latin/.LatinIME'])
Android only

steps.name: is ime active
steps.description:
Checks whether the device has IME service active. Returns True/False.
Android only

steps.name: activate ime engine
steps.description:
Activates the given IME engine on the device.
Android only

steps.name: deactivate ime engine
steps.description:
Deactivates the currently active IME engine on the device.
Android only

steps.name: get active ime engine
steps.description:
Returns the activity and package of the currently active IME engine (e.g.,
'com.android.inputmethod.latin/.LatinIME').
Android only

steps.name: update settings
steps.description:
Set settings for the current session.
For more on settings, see: https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/advanced-concepts/settings.md

steps.name: toggle location services
steps.description: Toggle the location services on the device. Android only

steps.name: set location
steps.description: Set the location of the device

steps.name: start recording screen
steps.description:
Start asynchronous screen recording process

:param options: The following options are supported:
- remotePath: The remotePath upload option is the path to the remote location,
where the resulting video from the previous screen recording should be uploaded.
The following protocols are supported: http/https (multipart), ftp.
Missing value (the default setting) means the content of the resulting
file should be encoded as Base64 and passed as the endpoint response value, but
an exception will be thrown if the generated media file is too big to
fit into the available process memory.
This option only has an effect if there is/was an active screen recording session
and forced restart is not enabled (the default setting).
- user: The name of the user for the remote authentication.
Only has an effect if both `remotePath` and `password` are set.
- password: The password for the remote authentication.
Only has an effect if both `remotePath` and `user` are set.
- method: The HTTP method name ('PUT'/'POST'). PUT method is used by default.
Only has an effect if `remotePath` is set.
- timeLimit: The actual time limit of the recorded video in seconds.
The default value for both iOS and Android is 180 seconds (3 minutes).
The maximum value for Android is 3 minutes.
The maximum value for iOS is 10 minutes.
- forcedRestart: Whether to ignore the result of previous capture and start a new recording
immediately (`True` value). By default  (`False`) the endpoint will try to catch and return the result of
the previous capture if it's still available.
- bugReport: Makes the recorder to display an additional information on the video overlay,
such as a timestamp, that is helpful in videos captured to illustrate bugs.
This option is only supported since API level 27 (Android P).

iOS Specific:
- videoQuality: The video encoding quality: 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'photo'. Defaults to 'medium'.
Only works for real devices.
- videoType: The format of the screen capture to be recorded.
Available formats: 'h264', 'mp4' or 'fmp4'. Default is 'mp4'.
Only works for Simulator.

Android Specific:
- videoSize: The video size of the generated media file. The format is WIDTHxHEIGHT.
The default value is the device's native display resolution (if supported),
1280x720 if not. For best results, use a size supported by your device's
Advanced Video Coding (AVC) encoder.
- bitRate: The video bit rate for the video, in megabits per second.
The default value is 4. You can increase the bit rate to improve video quality,
but doing so results in larger movie files.

:return: Base-64 encoded content of the recorded media file or an empty string
    if the file has been successfully uploaded to a remote location
    (depends on the actual `remotePath` value)

steps.name: stop recording screen
steps.description: Gather the output from the previously started screen recording to a media file

steps.name: set clipboard
steps.description:
Set the content of the system clipboard

:param content: The content to be set as bytearray string
:param content_type: One of ClipboardContentType items. Only ClipboardContentType.PLAINTEXT
is supported on Android
:param label: Optional label argument, which only works for Android

steps.name: set clipboard text
steps.description: Copies the given text to the system clipboard

steps.name: get clipboard
steps.description: Receives the content of the system clipboard

steps.name: get clipboard text
steps.description:
Receives the text of the system clipboard
Return the actual clipboard text or an empty string if the clipboard is empty

steps.name: match images features
steps.description:
Performs images matching by features.
docs: https://docs.opencv.org/3.0-beta/doc/py_tutorials/py_feature2d/py_matcher/py_matcher.html

steps.name: find image occurrence
steps.description:
Performs images matching by template to find possible occurrence of the partial image in the full image.
docs: https://docs.opencv.org/2.4/doc/tutorials/imgproc/histograms/template_matching/template_matching.html

steps.name: get images similarity
steps.description:
Performs images matching to calculate the similarity score between them.
The flow there is similar to the one used in
`find_image_occurrence`, but it is mandatory that both images are of equal resolution.
The method supports all image formats, which are supported by OpenCV

steps.name: get device time
steps.description: Returns the date and time from the device

steps.name: get battery info
steps.description: Retrieves battery information for the device under test
